intro: Ouratea gilgiana, commonly known as the silverleaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically glossy and have a distinct silver or white underside. Its small, clustered white flowers bloom in the spring and are followed by small, round berries. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
